result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson

records.addlTxt:
JusticePoint PreTrial Services VIOLATION Report dated November 2, 2022; received and filed.
GPS - Tamper Alert.

Defendant Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson in Court.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons Ms in Court for Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Conference held in chambers. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. State placed offer on the record. Defendant rejected offer. Court addressed State's Notice of Expert Testimony. Defense advised the Court of Daubert Motion and discovery issues. Court ordered Defense to file Daubert Motion on or before November 7, 2022. No additional issues need to be addressed at this time. Court ordered case adjourned for Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Jury Trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
ALL PARTIES MUST APPEAR IN-PERSON FOR FIRST CALL.
State's Notice of Expert Testimony; received and filed.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated October 12, 2022; received and filed.

JusticePoint PreTrial Services Status Report dated September 16, 2022; received and filed.
Missed Office Contact. Defendant REGAINED contact with JusticePoint.

Court ordered Defendant turned over to JUSTICE POINT FOR LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION. 
Court ordered ELECTRONIC MONITORING (GPS) - 'NO CONTACT ORDER' MONITORING ONLY.
Court ordered Defendant be released and placed on the GPS waitlist. 
Once an Electronic Monitoring (GPS) Device is available, Court ordered Defendant to report to JusticePoint within 48 hours for GPS Installation. If Defendant fails to report to JusticePoint, a warrant will be issued. 
Court ordered no possession or use of dangerous weapons and firearms.

Defendant Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson in Court, in custody.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons Ms in Court for Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Court addressed Demand for Speedy Trial. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding Bail. Court MODIFIED BAIL. Court set SIGNATURE BOND. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Final PreTrial scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 11:30 am in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Jury Trial scheduled scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Jury Status hearing. Defendant and State appeared Via Zoom Video Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense provided update to the Court regarding Discovery issue. State confirmed. For reasons stated on the record, State requested an adjournment. Court Granted State's request and VACATED Jury Trial date. Parties selected new dates. Court ordered case adjourned for Bail/Bond hearing, Final Pretrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Bail/Bond hearing scheduled August 29, 2022 at 9:00 am. Hearing will be held IN PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
Final PreTrial scheduled October 13, 2022 at 11:30 am. Hearing will be held IN PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
Jury Trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. ALL PARTIES MUST APPEAR IN-PERSON FOR FIRST CALL.
State's Alibi Rebuttal Witness List; received and filed.

Defendant Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Court reviewed Notice of Alibi filed by Defense. Discussion placed on the record. Partied provided update to the Court regarding Discovery issue. Case remains in trial posture. Court ordered case adjourned for Jury Status hearing and SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Jury Status hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 10:15 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. 
SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
Notice of Alibi; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Per Defense request and due to COVID-19 protocol for Mr. Ferguson, Final PreTrial scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 3:15pm will be held via ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.
Defendant will appear via ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.
Clerk provided information to MCSO and will make arrangements with HOC.

Defendant Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson in Court with Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Court reviewed Defense Motion to Compel Discovery and Motion to Enlarge Time to File Notice of Alibi. Discussion placed on the record. State to provide Defense with full discovery material/test results. Defense advised the Court due to COVID-19 protocol, she has not been able to meet with Defendant. Court GRANTED Defense Motion to Enlarge Time to File Notice of Alibi. For reasons stated on the record, case adjourned for Final PreTrial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Final PreTrial scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 03:15 pm. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
State's Motion in Limine; received and filed.
State's Proposed Jury Instructions; received and filed.
State's Witness List; received and filed.
Defendant's Motion to Enlarge time to File Alibi Notice; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
Defendant's Motion to Compel Discovery; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
Defense Motion in Limine; received and filed.
Defense Witness List; received and filed.

COURT INCREASED CASH BAIL TO $20,000.00.
All previously ordered conditions of Bail remain.

Defendant Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail. Court GRANTED States Motion to Increase Bail. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Speedy Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Final PreTrial scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 10:00 am. Hearing will be held Via Zoom Video Conference. Speedy Jury Trial scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant previously entered a Demand for Speedy Trial on JUNE 10, 2022.
EXPIRATION DATE IS SEPTEMBER 8, 2022.

Defendant Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson in Court with Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**  
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant also has Case 22CF2142, which is incorrectly assigned to Branch 46 and should be transferred to Branch 40. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material and an offer from the State. Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates, and requested to address bail. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Bail/Bond hearing, Final PreTrial, and SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46.  

Bail/Bond hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:25 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference. 
Final PreTrial scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 10:00 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson in court, appear by video with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons, appear by video.  Defendant Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective E. Tucker.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JSC, dob 7/17/2000 and AB, dob 7/31/1978

Defendant Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tvon Malik-Lee Ferguson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
